incidents.name: New TwiML Processor Migration Caused Change in Behavior for <Record> Transcribe Attribute

incident_updates.body: Twilio Programmable Voice 'Recording Transcriptions' service was degraded between 07/21/2023 and 08/05/2024. During this period of time customers may have experienced issues with transcriptions not being generated for calls that were passing transcribeCallback attribute and not passing transcribe attribute in the Record verb. The new TwiML processor migration change has been reflected in the Programmable Voice documentation. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Authy API unavailable for 2.5 minutes

incident_updates.body: Twilio Authy API and Authy APP was degraded for 2.5 minutes between 16:09:41 and 16:12:11 UTC on 08/12/2024. During the timeframe, the API experienced a significant number of failed requests due to DB connectivity issues. As a result, some customers were unable to initiate or verify their verifications and fetch the status about approval requests. In regard to the app's side, some end-users may have encountered errors in the Authy app. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Increased Rate of 500 Errors for Twilio Programmable Messaging API

incident_updates.body: Twilio Programmable Messaging API was degraded between 02:09 to 02:11 Pacific Time on 02/08/2024 and 18:06 to 18:08 Pacific Time on 04/08/2024. During this period, customers may have experienced increased latencies and 500 errors. The issue has now been resolved.

Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with AWS Increased rate of 500 errors for Twilio Programmable Messaging API. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

incidents.name: Real time Usage and Billing data is delayed

incident_updates.body: The issue with Programmable Wireless and Super SIM where customers are not able see amounts billed for data usage when viewing Usage in Console or via the UsageRecords APIs has been resolved and it is operating normally at this time.

We have addressed the issue with Programmable Wireless and Super SIM where customers are not able see amounts billed for data usage when viewing Usage in Console or via the UsageRecords APIs. The amounts billed will be updated once the incident is resolved and delayed records are processed. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or sooner once more information becomes available.

We continue to experience issue with Programmable Wireless and Super SIM where customers are not able see amounts billed for data usage when viewing Usage in Console or via the UsageRecords APIs. There are no delays in reporting the amount of bytes used by these SIMs. The amounts billed will be updated once the incident is resolved and delayed records are processed. Our engineering team is actively working on to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Potential Issues with Registering for FCM (Android, Web) Push Notifications

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing issue regarding registering for FCM (Android, Web) push notifications. This incident has been resolved.

We are observing recovery in registering for FCM (Android, Web) push notifications. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still investigating a potential issue with registering for FCM (Android, Web) push notifications. We've identified the underlying root cause as an outage of Google's Firebase Cloud Messaging service, which is used for push notifications across the Android ecosystem. We will provide an update in 4 hours or as soon as we observe recovery on Google's end.

We have identified the underlying root cause to be an outage of Google's Firebase Cloud Messaging service that is used as the vehicle for push notifications across the Android ecosystem.
